$sendMailExecute a mail template and ultimately send it

$setPageParamsset page paramters for this request

$getMethodGet the HTTP method used on this request
$getCurrentDirGet the current directory path assuming the application.pageDir is root.
$getCurrentPageGet the current page path assuming the application.pageDir is root.
$getRequestURLGet the requested URL
$getRequestIdGet the request Id, guaranteed to be unique to this instance of fincayra
$getCurrentPageUriGet the current page with .js removed
$getPagePathGet the path of the currentPage with pageDir as root
$getRealPathGet the full file system path to the current page
$getExtraPathGet the rest of the path after the path of the current page
$getPageSource
$sourceThis is the source widget for example pages
$execute$e in it’s shorthand form, this method loads the page into the document object and runs the page javascript
$forward$f in it’s shorthand form, this method forwards the request to the specified page
$include$i in it’s shorthand form, use this method to get the generated content from a page and add it’s head element to the current page
$json$j in it’s shorthand form, use this method to send an object as the HTTP response in JSON format
$doc$d in it’s shorthand form, use this method to set an Element as the HTTP response document
$headJSIncludes a js file in the head element
$headCSSIncludes a css file in the head element
$apiSet up a simple api page that uses the url as a key to the method called.
$getInstanceGet an object instance by name
$requireSSLRedirects to the ssl url of the requested page
$setValSet the value of a form element
$setValsSet the values of a form element
$setSessionClassSet the class to use for session
$setMaxInactiveIntervalSet the max interval between session access in seconds
$getHttpSessionThe javax.servlet.HttpSession
$getSessionThe fincayra session

Enumerations

Methods

The Http Mthods

POST”POST”
GET”GET”
PUT”PUT”
DELETE”DELETE”

Functions

$app

function $app()

Returns

A reference to the fincayra application

$getJsDir

function $getJsDir()

Get the path to the jsDir

$getPageDir

function $getPageDir()

Get the path to the pageDir

$watch

function $watch(file)

Watch a file for reload of root scope if application.reloadRootScope=true

Parameters

fileThe name of the file or folder to watch with path referenced to jsDir

Example

If jsDir is ‘fincayra-lib’ and file is ‘request.js’, then ‘fincayra-lib/request.js’ will be watched

$load

var $l = $load = function(file)

$l in it’s shorthand form, this function loads and executes JavaScript files from the jsDir and adds them to the watch list

Parameters

fileThe file to be loaded with path referenced to jsDir

$log

var $log = function()

Returns the logger

The logging implementation is slf4j Avoid string concatination by using like this

$log().debug("Hello {}", "World");

Enumerations

$log.Level

The log levels

  • ALL
  • DEBUG
  • ERROR
  • FATAL
  • INFO
  • OFF
  • TRACE
  • TRACE_INT
  • WARN

Functions

$setLogLevel

var $setLogLevel = function(config)

Set the log level

Parameters

configAn object containing the logger (String) and level $log.Level.  If the logger is left undefined, the root logger is used.

Examples

Set the org.fincayra logger to INFO

$setLogLevel({logger:"org.fincayra",level:$log.Level.INFO});

Set the root logger to ERROR

$setLogLevel({level:$log.Level.ERROR});

$getLogLevel

var $getLogLevel = function(name)

get the log level

Parameters

nameThe name of the logger or if left undefined, the root log level is returned

$type

var $type = function(obj)

Get the object type as a string

Paramters

objThe object to check the type of

Returns

The object type name

$hide

var $hide = function(paths)

Hide a path from http clients

Parameters

pathThe path to hide

$expose

var $expose = function(paths)

Because the root path of a fincayra application is the application directory and only .js and .html files will be served through the engine, you will have to call this method to expose static, non-html content such as image, javascript and css files.

You should make a call to this function in your server-js/app-root.js file.

Paramters

pathsAn array of paths to expose in the application directory as root paths in the application

Example

[fincayra-install-dir]/webapps/root/application contains -

+css
+dev
+images
+js
+mail
+server-js
+templates
+test
index.html
index.js

You run

$expose(["css","js","images"]);

This will expose

  • http://my.app.com/css
  • http://my.app.com/js
  • http://my.app.com/images

$setErrorPage

Set the error page that will handle exceptions

Parameters

pathThe path to the page with application.pageDir as root.

$href

var $href = function(parms)

Returns an anchor element as text that can be appended to another element

Parameters

parmsan object of the format
{text:'the Link text', url: 'http://the.url'}

If text is undefined, the url will be used as the text.

$sendMail

var $sendMail = function(path,
data)

Execute a mail template and ultimately send it

Parameters

pathThe path to the mail template js file relative to mailManager.templateDir
dataAm object to be accessible in the template as context.messageData

$connect

var $connect = function(url)

Connect using <Jsoup.connect url target=”http://jsoup.org/apidocs/org/jsoup/Jsoup.html#connect” name=”http://jsoup.org/apidocs/org/jsoup/Jsoup.html#connect”(java.lang.String)>

Parameters

urlthe url string to connect to

$mapToJS

var $mapToJS = function(map)

Convert a java.util.Map to a JavaScript Object

Paramters

mapthe map to convert

$encode

var $encode = function(text)

Encodes text for urls

Parameters

textThe text to encode

Returns

The encoded text

FileCache

A singleton Cache for js and html files to enhance performance

Summary
Functions
existsCheck if a file exists by path
getGet a file from the cache by path
clearClear a file from the cache
listList all the files in the cache
enableEnable or disable file caching

Functions

exists

exists : function(path)

Check if a file exists by path

Parameters

pathpath to a file

get

get : function(path)

Get a file from the cache by path

Parameters

pathThe path to the file

Returns

The file contents as a string

clear

clear : function(path)

Clear a file from the cache

Parameters

paththe path to the file or if no path is passed clear the whole cache

list

list :function()

List all the files in the cache

Returns

An array of file paths

enable

enable : function(e)

Enable or disable file caching

Parameters

etrue to enable, false to disable

Error

Summary
Functions
printStackTracePrint a stack trace of an Error or Java Exception

Functions

printStackTrace

Error.prototype.printStackTrace = function()

Print a stack trace of an Error or Java Exception

Array

Summary
Functions
eachLoop each element in an array and run the callback

Functions

each

Array.prototype.each = function(callback,
end)

Loop each element in an array and run the callback

Parameters

callbackA function to call that will be executed for each element of the array.  The callback will be passed the element as a parameter.
endThe number of items to iterate over or if left undefined, iterate over the entire Array.

Object

Summary
Functions
extendExtend an object

Functions

extend

Object.prototype.extend = function(oSuper)

Extend an object

Parameters

oSuperThe object to extend

Example

function ClassA () {
}

function ClassB() {
     this.extends(new ClassA());
}

String

Summary
Functions
tokenizeTokenize instances of {} in a string by passing their replacements as parameters
isLikeCompare this string to string passed in.

Functions

tokenize

String.prototype.tokenize = function()

Tokenize instances of {} in a string by passing their replacements as parameters

Parameters

str1,str2,str3,...

Example

"The {} {} bit the {}".tokenize("big","rat","postman");

Will return

"The big rat bit the postman"

isLike

String.prototype.isLike = function(str)

Compare this string to string passed in.

Params

strThe string to check existence of

Returns

true if the param string exists in this string ignoring case

Functions

$requestScope

Request.prototype.$requestScope = function()

Get the request scope

$getRequest

Request.prototype.$getRequest = function()

Get the HttpServletRequest

Returns

HttpServletRequest

$getPageDir

Request.prototype.$getPageDir = function()

Get the path to the pageDir

$load

Request.prototype.$l = Request.prototype.$load = function(file)

$l in it’s shorthand form, this method loads and executes JavaScript files

Parameters

fileThe file to be loaded

$

Request.prototype.$ = function(str)

Just like JQuery!  Find an element or elements in the current document by selector.  Runs the jsoup Element.select method on the element in the current context.  If html is passed in it will be parsed into a jsoup element.

Parameters

strThe selector or html to be parsed into a jsoup element

$remove

Request.prototype.$remove = function(el)

Remove an element from the dom and return it

Parameters

elThe element to remove

Returns

A clone of the removed element

$redirect

Request.prototype.$redirect = function(loc)

Sends a temporary redirect response to the client using the specified redirect location URL.

Parameters

locthe redirect location URL

Throws

java.io.IOExceptionIf an input or output exception occurs
java.lang.IllegalStateExceptionIf the response was committed or if a partial URL is given and cannot be converted into a valid URL

$getPageParams

Request.prototype.$getPageParams = function(checkJson)

Get the page parameters as an object.  Each key in the object is a parameter passed in on the request.

Parameters

checkjsonif true and the http method is POST or PUT, returns the json body as an object

Returns

The object containing the parameter keys and values

$setPageParams

Request.prototype.$setPageParams = function(params)

set page paramters for this request

Parameters

paramsA javascript object of params to set

$getRequestBody

Request.prototype.$getRequestBody = function()

Get the request body as a string

Returns

The request body as a string

$getMethod

Request.prototype.$getMethod = function()

Get the HTTP method used on this request

Returns

The HTTP method used on this request.  See Methods.

$getCurrentDir

Request.prototype.$getCurrentDir = function()

Get the current directory path assuming the application.pageDir is root.

Returns

The current directory path assuming the application.pageDir is root.

$getCurrentPage

Request.prototype.$getCurrentPage = function()

Get the current page path assuming the application.pageDir is root.

Returns

The current page path assuming the application.pageDir is root.

Get the requested URL

Returns

The requested URLString

Get the request Id, guaranteed to be unique to this instance of fincayra

Returns

requestIdNumber

Get the current page with .js removed

The current page with .js removed

Get the path of the currentPage with pageDir as root

The path of the currentPage with pageDir as root

Request.prototype.$getRealPath = function()

Get the full file system path to the current page

Request.prototype.$getExtraPath = function()

Get the rest of the path after the path of the current page

The rest of the path after the path of the current page

$getPageSource

Request.prototype.$getPageSource = function()
Get the current page source as a stringgreat for the examples site

Returns

The page source.

$source

Request.prototype.$source = function()

This is the source widget for example pages

Just add a call to the end of your page, and see what happens

$execute

Request.prototype.$e = Request.prototype.$execute = function(page,
c)

$e in it’s shorthand form, this method loads the page into the document object and runs the page javascript

Examples

These all do the same thing

$e("/recover.js");
$e("/recover.html");
$e("/recover");

Parameters

pagePath to the page that will be executed with application.pageDir as root.

$forward

Request.prototype.$f = Request.prototype.$forward = function(page)

$f in it’s shorthand form, this method forwards the request to the specified page

Parameters

pageThe page to be forwarded to with application.pageDir as root

Examples

These all do the same thing

$f("/recover.js");
$f("/recover.html");
$f("/recover");

$include

Request.prototype.$i = Request.prototype.$include = function(page)

$i in it’s shorthand form, use this method to get the generated content from a page and add it’s head element to the current page

Parameters

pagethe path tho the page with application.pageDir as root, or relative path from current page

Returns

The document element (body) fo the page to be included

$json

Request.prototype.$j = Request.prototype.$json = function(obj,
replacer,
contentType)

$j in it’s shorthand form, use this method to send an object as the HTTP response in JSON format

Parameters

objthe object to send in the HTTP response (required)
replacerA replacer function see <JSON2.js http://www.json.org/js.html> or undefined
contentTypeA string representation of the response content-type header you wish to set or undefined

$doc

Request.prototype.$d = Request.prototype.$doc = function(el)

$d in it’s shorthand form, use this method to set an Element as the HTTP response document

Parameters

elthe element to use as HTTP response document

$headJS

Request.prototype.$headJS = function(path)

Includes a js file in the head element

Parameters

pathThe path to the js file relative to pageDir

$headCSS

Request.prototype.$headCSS = function(path)

Includes a css file in the head element

Parameters

pathThe path to the css file relative to pageDir

$api

Request.prototype.$api = function(actions)

Set up a simple api page that uses the url as a key to the method called.

Example

Say the path to the page is /api/user.  You will then have a user.js file.  If you want an add method you would call /api/user/add from the client, and in the user.js file you would have...

$api({
   add: function() {
       //add a user here
       var user = new User($getPageParams(true));
       //Do some validation
       user.save();
   }
});

Parameters

actionsan object containing a mapping of action names to functions

$getInstance

Request.prototype.$getInstance = function(type)

Get an object instance by name

Parameters

typeA string with the name of the type to instantiate

Returns

An object instance

$requireSSL

Request.prototype.$requireSSL = function()

Redirects to the ssl url of the requested page

$setVal

Request.prototype.$setVal = function(object,
name)

Set the value of a form element

Parameters

objectThe object that holds the data
nameThe name of the attribute, also the id of the form field

$setVals

Request.prototype.$setVals = function(object,
names)

Set the values of a form element

Parameters

objectThe object that holds the data
namesan array of attribute names (also the id of the form field)

$setSessionClass

Request.prototype.$setSessionClass = function(clazz)

Set the class to use for session

Parameters

clazzA reference to the class

Default

FincayraSession

$setMaxInactiveInterval

Request.prototype.$setMaxInactiveInterval = function(seconds)

Set the max interval between session access in seconds

Parameters

secondsThe number of seconds to keep session alive between calls

$getHttpSession

Request.prototype.$getHttpSession = function()

Returns

The javax.servlet.HttpSession

$getSession

Request.prototype.$getSession = function()

Returns

The fincayra session
